This book was definitely my favorite of all the banned books I‚Äôve read so far. Why? Because it is a biographical collection of kids telling their own stories about being transgender and their experiences growing up. As our understanding of biology, gender identity and sexuality has developed as a society, it has become clear that we still have a ton of work to do. Transgender children are facing horrors and abuses that are unacceptable and it something everyone should be working to change.
‚ú®
It is definitely heartbreaking to hear what these kids have gone through, yet their stories are insightful and powerful. These kids are bravely telling their stories even though we still haven‚Äôt created a world that properly recognizes our true biology of diversity, and the reality that gender identity and sexuality are spectrums not either/ors. That gives me a lot of hope for the future. The author did a great job collecting, telling, and also showing the lives of some very brave kids. 
.
I recommend this book for everyone, because understanding others, empathizing with experiences that differ from our own, and creating a world that accepts a diversity that truly honors us  as people, is something we should be aiming for‚ù§Ô∏è
